revised_title: Preservation and History of Newton's Dial at Woolsthorpe
tldr: The author describes the removal and preservation of the Newtonian Dial, a historical monument located at Woolsthorpe, the birthplace of Sir Isaac Newton. The dial was marked on a stone at the Manor-house of Woolsthorpe and had the name 'NEWTON' inscribed on it. The gnomon, however, had disappeared many years prior to the author's account.
